messages.subject: Re: cutting fabric
messages.msgSnippet: This is cracking me up.  Our cat (the remaining 8yr.old if you have been reading about the pets and death) used to not mind the vaccuum, even going so far as
messages.messageBody:
This is cracking me up. Our cat (the remaining 8yr.old if you have
been reading about the pets and death) used to not mind the vaccuum,
even going so far as chasing the nozzle and sitting on the canister.
Well, I had the brilliant idea to vacuum him one day and now he runs
for the hills when he hears it start up. Won't ever be able to do
that again. Ugh the pet hair! Oh well.
Tina







--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Lisa M. Cottrell
Bentley" <cottrellbentley@c...> wrote:
> > "Vacuum the dog? <g>"
> > Tia
> >
> > You may laugh, but my Mom vacuumed all of our cats every week.
The poor
> dears had to get used to it, Mom did it from the time they were
very little
> and most of them learned to love that nozzle being rubbed over
them...silly,
> but effective in a house with several cats.
> >
> > Ren
> >
>
> My Dad had read about vacuuming a cat (to help with shedding) and
he and I
> tried this with my cat when I was 13. The cat was about 6-7 years
old and I
> ended up in the emergency room. I still have a scar on my finger,
the one
> fingernail was almost completely torn off. Be careful, some
animals
> consider this abuse and won't stand for it. I can, however, see
how a
> little baby kitten could grow to love such a thing.
>
> -Lisa in AZ

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] cutting fabric
messages.msgSnippet: ... dears had to get used to it, Mom did it from the time they were very little and most of them learned to love that nozzle being rubbed over them...silly,
messages.messageBody:
> "Vacuum the dog? <g>"
> Tia
>
> You may laugh, but my Mom vacuumed all of our cats every week. The poor
dears had to get used to it, Mom did it from the time they were very little
and most of them learned to love that nozzle being rubbed over them...silly,
but effective in a house with several cats.
>
> Ren
>

My Dad had read about vacuuming a cat (to help with shedding) and he and I
tried this with my cat when I was 13. The cat was about 6-7 years old and I
ended up in the emergency room. I still have a scar on my finger, the one
fingernail was almost completely torn off. Be careful, some animals
consider this abuse and won't stand for it. I can, however, see how a
little baby kitten could grow to love such a thing.

-Lisa in AZ

messages.subject: cutting fabric
messages.msgSnippet: Vacuum the dog?  Tia You may laugh, but my Mom vacuumed all of our cats every week. The poor dears had to get used to it, Mom did it from the time they
messages.messageBody:
"Vacuum the dog? <g>"
Tia

You may laugh, but my Mom vacuumed all of our cats every week. The poor dears had to get used to it, Mom did it from the time they were very little and most of them learned to love that nozzle being rubbed over them...silly, but effective in a house with several cats.

Ren
